scenarioDescription:
The HD 95338 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 95338 is a star with 0.83 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.87 times its radius. It is located 120.66 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 5.08 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 95338 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 95338 system


HD 95338 b

HD 95338 b was discovered by the Las Campanas Observatory observatory, in 2020-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.26 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 95338 b is 42.463 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 95338 b is 3.890 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 95338 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 95338, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Las Campanas Observatory.
name: HD 95338 - System With 1 Exoplanet
